trans-unit.source: Represents authentication information in Authorization, ProxyAuthorization, WWW-Authenticate, and Proxy-Authenticate header values.

The AuthenticationHeaderValue class provides support for the Authorization, ProxyAuthorization, WWW-Authenticate, and Proxy-Authenticate HTTP header values as defined in [RFC 2616](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=241642) by the IETF.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> class.
The scheme to use for authorization.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> class.
The scheme to use for authorization.
The credentials containing the authentication information of the user agent for the resource being requested.
Determines whether the specified <xref:System.Object> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> object.
The object to compare with the current object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified <xref:System.Object> is equal to the current object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Serves as a hash function for an <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> object.
A hash code is a numeric value that is used to identify an object during equality testing.
It can also serve as an index for an object in a collection.
The GetHashCode method is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
A hash code for the current object.
Gets the credentials containing the authentication information of the user agent for the resource being requested.
The credentials containing the authentication information.
Converts a string to an <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> instance.
A string that represents authentication header value information.
An <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> instance.
input is a reference.
input is not valid authentication header value information.
Gets the scheme to use for authorization.
The scheme to use for authorization.
Creates a new object that is a copy of the current <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> instance.
A copy of the current instance.
Returns a string that represents the current <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> object.
A string that represents the current object.
Determines whether a string is valid <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> information.
The string to validate.
The <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.AuthenticationHeaderValue"></xref> version of the string.
if input is valid information; otherwise, .
